item.title: Publishing NuGet packages with GitHub Actions
item.author: Author
item.description: Recently I wrote a post on automating DocFX with GitHub Actions. Now it’s time to use similar automation to publish NuGet packages!

item.title: DocFX automation with GitHub Actions
item.author: Author
item.description: Publishing a DocFX page manually each time you change it is yet another tedious step that would need to be performed during release. Recently I was releasing v1.0.0 of my Wolfringo library, and I set up automated publishing using GitHub Actions!

item.title: Adding Regex Commands to Discord.Net's Command System
item.author: Author
item.description: Discord.Net includes a basic string + parameters Command System, which is enough for most peoples’ needs. However I like to use Regex for my commands. In this blog post, I explain how I added Regex Commands support for my personal admin bot Einherji.

item.title: Nginx and ASP.NET Core: Running both, HTTP REST and gRPC services, at once
item.author: Author
item.description: gRPC services are great - they’re fast and lightweight. However, for many use cases, REST WebAPI is also desirable. This post explains how to run them both at once.

item.title: Migrating from Wordpress to Hugo
item.author: Author
item.description: Recently I migrated this very blog from Wordpress to Hugo. It wasn’t a hard task, nor it was a very long one - but still I encountered some challenges, so I decided to document that. Plus when a change like this happens, some explanation is needed anyway.
